last_episode_to_air.name: New Holy Ground
last_episode_to_air.overview: With The Purge imminent, the ETU has no choice but to trust an unlikely  informant, leading all paths to converge at the primary Hunter base for a  climactic showdown.

name: Hunters
overview: The disappearance of a decorated FBI agent's wife leads him to a secret government unit assembled to hunt a group of ruthless terrorists - shadowy figures that may or may not be from this world.

episodes.name: The Beginning and the End
episodes.overview: A troubled Baltimore FBI agent becomes involved with a secret government unit assembled to hunt a group of ruthless terrorists, who may or may not be from this world, and who may or may not be involved in his wife's disappearance.

episodes.name: Messages
episodes.overview: Flynn and the ETU investigate violent attacks on U.S. soil, and discover the Hunters are working with human collaborators.

episodes.name: Maid of Orleans
episodes.overview: After a succumbing to a particularly nasty Hunter urge, young Regan learns the truth about what she is from her father ... and his knife.

episodes.name: Love and Violence
episodes.overview: McCarthy is captured as Flynn's search for his wife leads to desperate actions. Plus: Get ready for a Hunter birth!

episodes.name: Her Body in My Soul
episodes.overview: Flynn stumbles upon startling new information about his wife, which leads the ETU to a suspected human-hunter collaborator, while Flynn finds himself in an unexpected confrontation.

episodes.name: Bunker Soldier
episodes.overview: The ETU's discovery of the name and suspected location of a High Value Target, dredges up old memories for Jackson. Meanwhile, Flynn, Regan and Briggs attempt a daring raid on a Turkish prison.

episodes.name: Kissing the Machine
episodes.overview: The Hunters attempt to "reprogram" a captive Regan. While the ETU work to locate their missing agent, they deal with the possibility that there could be a mole in their ranks.

episodes.name: The More I See You
episodes.overview: Regan discovers that she wasn't told the truth about her father's disappearance. Meanwhile, Flynn and Briggs race against the Hunters to acquire a scientist critical to "The Purge."

episodes.name: Promise
episodes.overview: Flynn (Nathan Phillips) struggles with his self-destructive downward  spiral, Regan (Britne Oldford) confronts her mother, and the Hunters  make last-minute preparations for The Purge.

episodes.name: Our System
episodes.overview: Flynn (Nathan Phillips) faces his demons by visiting the only other  Marine in his platoon to survive their captivity in Afghanistan.  Meanwhile, the ETU discovers that Emme (Shannon Berry) might know too  much.

episodes.name: Telegraph
episodes.overview: The ETU finally cracks the Hunter language, allowing Finnerman (Sarah  Peirse) to set a trap. Regan (Britne Oldford) questions whether all  Hunters are terrorists, or whether some may be innocents living among  us.

episodes.name: Pretending to See the Future
episodes.overview: In the fallout of the Hunter roundup, Jackson (Lewis Fitz-Gerald) and  Finnerman (Sarah Peirse) are at odds with each other. The ETU's only  hope of stopping The Purge is to make a risky move on the Hunter's  weapons' supplier, Viktor Karp (Erroll Shand).

episodes.name: New Holy Ground
episodes.overview: With The Purge imminent, the ETU has no choice but to trust an unlikely  informant, leading all paths to converge at the primary Hunter base for a  climactic showdown.
